functions.name: findBelongsTo

functions.name: captureRouteTransitionsFrom
functions.description: Captures all Transition objects created from callback

params.name: callback
params.description:
The callback function is passed in a few utility functions to control route transitions.
visit
v def
  • visit
  • linkTo
  • forward
  • back
  • links

functions.name: captureNetworkConnectionFrom
functions.description: Captures all network requests from callback

params.name: modelName
params.description: The model name for the matching serializer that is under test.

params.name: payload
params.description: The payload that is going to be normalized

params.name: id
params.description:
The id for the model represented by payload. By default,
  the helper will try to infer from the model name and payload.

params.name: requestType
params.description:
The request type used by the adapter invoking the normalizeResponse hook.
  By default, the helper will try to infer from the model name and payload.

  `{ includeId: true }`.

attributes.name: NormalizedResponse
attributes.description: NormalizedResponse is an object that represent the returned value from Serializer#normalizeResponse

fields.name: jsonapi
fields.description: The json-api representation of the normalized response. This is the return value from your Serialize#normalizeResponse

fields.name: raw
fields.description:
The raw representation of the normalized response. This is the payload value you pass to your super calls in your Serializer#normalizeResponse.

The reason that you may want to use this value is because it is more concise than the json-api representation and more performant since it bypasses the json-api normalization step.
